content: What capital city, located on the Potomac River, was named in honor of the first U.S. president?

The capital city you're referring to is Washington, D.C., which is indeed located along the Potomac River. It was named in honor of George Washington, the first President of the United States. The "D.C." stands for "District of Columbia," a federal district that encompasses the city. This unique arrangement was created to ensure that the nation's capital would be independent of any state government.
